comments:
PROBLEM: font from gmf diagram layer somehow not getting initialized properly in compare/merge session. This is a regression. It was working. Compare/merge didn't change any code recently. I discussed the problem with Mohammed Mostafa. He confirmed that GMF diagram layer has done some significant changes with font recently. Since this problem breaks compare/merge badly, could you please take a look at this problem as soon as possible.




STEPS to REPRODUCE: (RSx, using latest constellation target)
1) create a modeling project named project1
2) create a uml model under it named b.emx
3) copy/paste b.emx to create c1.emx
4) copy/paste b.emx to create c2.emx
5) open c1.emx::Main diagram and drag/drop a Class shape on the diagram from palette
6) open c2.emx::Main diagram and drag/drop a class shape on the diagram from palette
7) save c1.emx
8) save c2.emx
9) Close all open diagrams (if any of c1.emx::Main or c2.emx::Main is open, the problem won't happen).
10) multi-select b.emx, c1.emx and c2.emx. Right click. Compare with Each Other. RSx compare/merge editor shows up.

However, looking at the compare/merge editor, diagram viewers are empty. There is exception in the error log......

This problem happens, because the client deactivate the edit parts while still showing the figures.
The Graphical edit part will realease the fonts at deactivation, which means the figures will try to use disposed fonts and that is whythe exceptions happen
reassign the defect to cherie to consider releaseing -the fonts at a later stage

Purpose: 
- I recently added code that disposes the font used by an editpart in the deactivate() method.  This broke client code because it was deactivating editparts even though.  I moved the disposing of the font code into the removeNotify() method as recommended by Randy.  This code will be called when the editpart is permanently removed from the viewer.   

Code Reviewed by: 
Mohammed. 

How tested: 
Manual Tests: 
- Mohammed verified that the client code worked with my changes. 
- Verified with Sleak that fonts are not leaked when changing fonts on a shape, moving to a different parent, closing the diagram, and deleting the shape. 

JUnit Tests:   
org.eclipse.gmf.tests.runtime.diagram.ui -- all passed 

Impact on QE: 
n/a

n/a 

Impact on build: 
n/a 

Delivered to Stream(s): 
dev.eclipse.org:/home/technology (R1_0_maintenance)
